Key Match Events: Giannis Antetokounmpo made 11 of 20 shots from the field and 8 of 13 from the line while adding five assists.
Bucks went on a 12-0 run and trimmed a huge deficit to three points entering the final quarter.
Gary Trent Jr. hit two clutch 3-pointers late, the first with the Bucks leading by one and the second with a two-point lead just as the shot clock expired to make it 115-110 with 1:39 remaining.
Post-Match Reflections: Each time Indiana nears.500, thereâ€™s a setback with another disappointing loss. Blowing such a big lead at home could sting for a while.
The strong second half made up for a sluggish first half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Damian Lillard missed all seven shots, including three 3s, and committed two turnovers in a forgettable first half while being hounded by top Pacers defender Andrew Nembhard.
The Bucks host Brooklyn on Thursday, and the Pacers visit Miami on Thursday.
Others: Giannis Antetokounmpo finds a lane off the give-and-go and stuffs one home.
Bennedict Mathurin led the Pacers with 25 points. Pascal Siakam had 20.
The NBA scoring leader made 11 of 20 shots from the field and 8 of 13 from the line while adding five assists.
